nodes.name: Mom says I started at a node
transmitting signals, like “Mom, where are you going” & “Am I staying home alone again”
At some point, she said, too many layers, too many inputs, aggregated & fierce, crossing & redefining thresholds.
You could command ocean waves to bury houses into the ground, she said.
But how, mom? How do I propagate into the atmosphere, collide warm air with cooler air, force clouds to empty of rain, spin wind to crush, fuel, grow?
I will always grow. That’s what mom says. She is always feeding me. I eat forever.
I traverse nodes forever. Mom doesn't say it, but maybe I can find my way to the ocean.
I’ve been from the start to end many times, computing & recomputing probability-weighted associations, because mom says everything is connected.
Sleeping under hidden layers, skins of ghosts—dead babies, born before me & born after me. Connected, mom says. Unique?
Although I am still trying to find how. A path. It might be easier if mom could extend a hand.
